page.title: 07THE COASTGUARD STATION
page.content: There has been a coastguard station since 1930 for Ilfracombe.The coastguards are part time and have other jobs,such as a postman,a dentist a farmer and a man who is unemployed. An auxiliary coastguard called Mr Beale showed us all the equipment. Coastguards travel in a Land Rover with radios, a spade,ropes,helmets, torches,rocket gun,flares and first aid, ready to rescue anyone stranded on rocks or cut off by the tide on the beach.Inside the operations room there is a radio for contacting other coast- guards,the lifeboat,police,ambulance, firebrigade or the RAF rescue helicopter.There is also an inflatable craft for inshore rescue.A few weeks ago it towed a stranded shark back out to sea.Silly holiday makers keep the coastguards busy in the summer.
